children.text:
Where are you, Cristóbal?
Come here to let me ask you again…
In a rush, once more, the voice returns.

Why do you sit so near?
Cristóbal… Cristóbal…
I feel you close.

Listen to me, listen to me!
My voice flies toward you like a bird
that descends over the world’s love.

In you my song was born, in your hands.
You who dream and awaken… and awaken.

Butterflies arrived; I know you are listening to me,
because my song takes flight.
If you did not hear my voice, it would not fly.

In you my song is born; for you I could cross
the tumultuous river of the days
or the serene river of the nights.

And there, on the other shore,
to stop and listen to its own love of water,
of one in love.

I know you hear me, in life or in death.
If you did not hear it, my song would not sound.

I feel you beating in the wings of every butterfly,
in every green shimmer,
in the wind or the water,
in the depths of the jungle.

In life or in death, I feel you beating.
In the flight of my song, in the gentle air,
I feel you in the air.

Cristóbal, Cristóbal!
I feel you beating in the gentle air of my song.
I feel you in the air… I feel you, Cristóbal.
